title: SATVA THE GREEN CITY
description: A sustainable urban design redefining how green spaces can thrive within modern cities.
fullDescription: SATVA is a futuristic green city concept that prioritizes eco-living, community health, and energy efficiency. With vertical gardens, green rooftops, and integrated public transport, the city embodies harmony between nature and urban life.
challenge: Designing a city that could sustain high-density populations while maintaining low carbon emissions.
solution: sed renewable energy grids, green corridors, and smart water management systems to enhance sustainability.
outcome: SATVA received global acclaim for its innovation, becoming a benchmark in sustainable urban planning.

title: Sensory Architecture
description: A design project that explores how spaces can emotionally and physically connect with people.
fullDescription: Sensory Architecture creates immersive environments that respond to light, sound, and touch, enhancing user experience. It combines neuroscience, spatial design, and smart materials to engage all five senses.
challenge: Integrating sensory-responsive elements into architectural design without overwhelming users.
solution: Implemented adaptive lighting, sound-absorbing textures, and natural ventilation systems based on user feedback.
outcome: Widely adopted in hospitals, schools, and museums to improve comfort, focus, and emotional well-being.

title: Chaya - Self Sustaining House
description: A revolutionary home that lives off the grid, combining comfort with environmental responsibility.
fullDescription: Chaya is a self-sustaining residential model designed to operate with minimal external energy or resource input. It includes solar panels, rainwater harvesting, and composting systems.
challenge: Making the house entirely independent from municipal utilities while maintaining modern standards.
solution: Deployed passive solar heating, greywater recycling, and IoT-based energy tracking systems.
outcome: Achieved 95% self-sufficiency and has been replicated as a model in multiple eco-villages.

title: Concrete Pipe Housing
description: Innovative micro-housing using recycled concrete pipes for compact, urban living.
fullDescription: This project converts industrial concrete pipes into fully functional, affordable micro-homes. It's a response to the growing need for quick, efficient, and sustainable urban housing.
challenge: Transforming heavy, rigid pipes into livable, safe, and aesthetic living spaces.
solution: Introduced modular interiors with lightweight materials, insulation, and efficient ventilation systems.
outcome: Adopted in urban slums and disaster relief areas as an affordable and scalable housing solution.

title: Under Water City
description: A visionary approach to building a city below the sea, tackling overpopulation and rising sea levels.
fullDescription: Under Water City is a conceptual smart city built beneath ocean surfaces, using advanced marine engineering. It aims to provide a futuristic alternative to overcrowded urban areas.
challenge: Ensuring safety, structural integrity, and habitability under deep-sea pressure.
solution: Used dome-shaped pressurized habitats, transparent aluminum, and tidal energy systems.
outcome: The project won international design awards and influenced marine architecture development.

title: The Scintillating Sembalance
description: A dazzling urban landmark project that balances form, light, and movement.
fullDescription: This futuristic public pavilion blends parametric design with kinetic elements to create dynamic structures that shift with light and wind. It becomes an interactive sculpture for the community.
challenge: Designing an architectural structure that evolves visually throughout the day.
solution: Integrated responsive facades with rotating panels and solar sensors to create a shifting visual effect.
outcome: Became a cultural icon and tourist attraction, redefining public engagement with architecture.
